qas.question: What directional shore of Bermuda is home to the majority of its hotels?

answers.text: the south shore of the island

qas.question: Bermuda's coral reefs, shipwrecks, and shallow waters are great for what activity in particular?
Historic St. George's has been given what distinction?
What odd color of sand draws tourists to Bermuda's beaches?
What makes Bermuda a popular tourist destination?

answers.text: pink sand beaches and clear, cerulean blue ocean waters

qas.question: Where are the majority of Bermuda's hotels?
What has St. George been designated as?
Why are divers attracted to Bermuda?

answers.text: numerous wrecks and coral reefs in relatively shallow water

qas.question: Why is Bermuda a great place for snorkellers?

answers.text: Many nearby reefs are readily accessible from shore

qas.question: What are located along the shore of the coral reefs?
What can be explored in 9-12 ft of water?
What can be explored in 30-40 m of water?
